comments:
Some files specifically *.jsp and *.xml files are being locked by eclipse. When
I open the file, type in changes, then try to save them, it brings up a dialog,
title="Save problems" text="Save could not be completed. Reason: Could not write
file:<filename>" (with <filename> as the fully qualified path to the filename.
The files are not read only on the file system but I can not delete the files
nor edit (save over) them with any other editor. As soon as I exit eclipse the
file is editable/deleteable again.

This only started happening once I upgraded to the recent webtools project. I
did do a clean install of everything, the specific files I used are : 

eclipse-SDK-3.1M6-win32.zip
emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-I200504141117.zip
GEF-SDK-3.1M6.zip
JEM-SDK-I20050415.zip
wtp-1.0M4.zip
wtp-wst-1.0M4.zip

It also seems that it happens after I do a search (like search for all *.jsp
files with foo() in them then open the files via the search results window). But
I'm not sure if that's the only time it happens. It happens to me quite often
and fairly consistently when I'm searching for results then editing those files.

for got to mention my version of java : 

C:\tmp>java -fullversion
java full version "1.5.0_01-b08"

(I'll try 1.5.0_03 now, I thought I upgraded but the path was wrong before).

just confirmed that it also happens in 
c:\cvs>java -fullversion
java full version "1.5.0_03-b07"

The better test would be to test with a 1.4x version. I believe as a whole, the
3.1 version is spec'd to "run on" 1.4 (even though it can produce code targeted
for 1.5). 

I doubt this is JRE version related, though. Can you check your .metadata/log
file for any interesting exceptions?

I just noticed you listed both
wtp-1.0M4.zip
wtp-wst-1.0M4.zip

but wtp already includes wst, so should just need to install/unzip wtp. 
perhaps there's something wrong with wst build specifically, so can you please 
try a fresh install and leave out the wtp-wst-1.0M4.zip?

I've done another clean install to make sure I did the wst packacges propery, it
still locks the files.

I cleaned out my .metadata/.log files so this time I was able to get something
usefull out of the file. The stack trace is pasted here. Just to be safe with my
employer I've changed the path to "/mypath" it shouldn't be an issue with my
path though, all normal directory names and stuff, no funny characters or spaces.

Below is 2 cases of it, one was when I was doing a cvs update, it couldn't write
to the file, the second time I openned up the file (same file) in the editor and
just added a space to the beginning of the file, then tried to save it.

Sorry for not replying soon ... can you clarify ... is there anything special
about your file system, or CVS? I'm asking due to the Resource Exception 

org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException(c:/cvs/mypath/home.jsp)[272]:
java.io.FileNotFoundException: c:\cvs\mypath\home.jsp (The requested operation
cannot be performed on a file with a user-mapped section open)

I'm not familar with a "user-mapped section" is, and trying to find out 
more about it. I also can't help notice that your command prompt says "cvs". 
You are not working with Eclipse right in the CVS directory, or anything unusual
like that, are you?

Doing a google ... I happened to run accross an unrelated problem with unrelated
software, but with same sort of exception, and one person replied ..
"Apparently, this was a problem with the Trend Micro Serverprotect virus
scanner. " ... you don't happen to have that installed do you? Or ... think you
could try some (safe) tests with virus scanner turned off?

No there's nothing special about my file system or CVS, the exact same machine /
OS install was working just before I updated to those WST files, I can't
remember the exact version I was previously running but it was eclipse 3.1.

No I'm not working "in" the CVS directory, I just happened to call my working
directory c:/cvs/* . (and I'll not that this was the same working space that I
was using with my previous 3.1 install too).

As for the user-mapped section, I'm not quite sure, the only thing that comes to
mind is the NIO file map stuff - but I haven't used it much. When the file is
"locked" I can not modify it (using another text editor, or by attempting a
delete xxx.jsp). As soon as I exit eclipse, I can do those operations though.

I'm going to also note that I have a separate install of this WST on linux and I
don't have this problem on that at all on that setup.

As for virus scanner, I had disabled and uninstalled all virus scanners on my
machine at that point, that was one of the first things that came to mind. But
I'll also have to come back to the point that the file is locked from any other
external program access as well but becomes available as soon as I exit eclipse.

P.S. I'm not actually too concerned about this bug as I never get it in linux
and that's my main setup now, I thought I'd just report it incase it's something
that was a symptom of a bigger problem or in case other people have the same
problem too.
just moving to appropriate component for bugzilla book keeping

I have asked some experts to try and educate me on what this stack trace means. 
If/when I hear back from them, I may have more to do here. 
But, otherwise, without a scenerio where I can reproduce, I'm not sure how 
to fix or even if related to editors per se. 

Definititely don't want to close it too soon though ... as time allows, I or
others can experiment.

Ted (or should I say Tedman?) can you attach or say a little about how your
prefernces are set? I recently set "refresh automatically" and "save
automatically on build" ... and noticed a few odd Eclipse errrors ... not this
one, exactly, but low level enough to make me wonder if this could be related to
preferences settings?

here are a few of the settings 

- General : always run in background enabled
- Workspace
        - build automatically off
        - save automatically before build off
        - workspace save interval 5
        - refresh automatically on

let me know if there's some specific ones you want. thanx
no longer have the working environment to verify this, I'm assuming it's not a problem.

Thanks, John Lanuti
